techmeme.title: Dick Kramlich, who co-founded NEA in 1977, died on February 1 at age 89; he was an early investor in Apple and led investments in Juniper Networks and others (Ben Bergman/Business Insider)
Source: Salesforce is cutting 1,000+ roles and will allow displaced workers to apply for other jobs internally; Salesforce had ~73,000 workers as of Jan. 2024 (Brody Ford/Bloomberg)
Sources: Thomas Shedd, GSA's new Technology Transformation Services director and Elon Musk ally, told GSA workers the agency will pursue an "AI-first strategy" (Makena Kelly/Wired)
A US appeals court panel appeared skeptical of Google's bid to overturn a 2023 jury verdict that declared the Play Store an illegal monopoly in the Epic case (Bloomberg)
Anthropic details Constitutional Classifiers, a system that aims to guard AI models against jailbreaks, monitoring both inputs and outputs for harmful content (Cristina Criddle/Financial Times)
